abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Real Estate
            Cadastre and Registration Project for Macedonia, former
            Yugoslav Republic of is to build an efficient and effective
            real estate cadastre and registration system, contributing
            to the development of efficient land and real estate
            markets. This restructuring will bring the following
            changes: (1) an extension of the current project closing
            date by 18 months; (2) a revision of the results framework;
            and (3) a revision of the design of component two to support
            upgrade of existing software systems for improved
            registration service delivery and training for the
            implementing agency staff. It has been prepared upon request
            of the Borrower, which was presented to the Bank in form of
            the correspondence from the Ministry of Finance (MOF) on
            April 12, 2013. It's main purpose is to reflect the
            impact of 18-month loan disbursement ceiling imposed by the
            Government in 2011-2012 to mitigate the impact of the global
            financial crises on the economy.
